instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, seems like brain dead
threads.message:
Hello, got a 00928 come in as water damaged but upon checking, liquid never hit the board. most on the LCD connector. nothing seems burned. diode reading on backlight output and MUX data pins are good.

right now macbook does not boot fully, no backlight or image either, using an external display i get the same black screen.
HOWEVER, I'm able to get to the startup manager by holding the option key, after selecting the drive i get no activity after this. This is on external display, nothing on recovery and nothing on diagnostic.

on the LCD i get nothing(known good LCD), i'm not getting <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> for backlight enable, i do have 5v and 3v3 going into the tcon.
i'm not sure if the no boot symptom is causing no display.

update** SMC bypass mode gives me low battery sign

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, seems like brain dead
threads.message:
Any liquid spill on LCD assembly affects MLB also; through J8500.

No reason to search for backlight, if you don't get image first on its LCD.
Low battery sign appeared on external monitor only?
Test the machine with known good battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, seems like brain dead
threads.message:
low battery sign appearing on known good LCD, my guess is the orignal LCD is dead. but that does not explain why it does not boot
will try a battery first, but i thought the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> did not need a battery to boot and with battery i can't do smc bypass?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, seems like brain dead
threads.message:
ok further updates,
When nothing is connected to board only screen, SMC bypass shows  which showing low battery sign.
but when kb and tp is connected during smc bypass, i get high fan spin, and nothing after that.
no different with another battery, mac is not booting.
any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, seems like brain dead
threads.message:
Test the board with external monitor; disconnect internal LCD.
Using charged battery, still get low battery sign?

KB/TP may be affected by liquid spill...
